Identification_Area.title: GO VEN PLS SUMM VENUS ET V1.0

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Frank, L.A., K.L. Ackerson, and W.R. Patterson, Plasma Measurements at Earth With the Galileo Spacecraft, AGU Spring Meeting, Baltimore, Maryland, May 1991.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: GO VEN PLS SUMM VENUS ET V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
This file is a listing of particle energy spectra from the Galileo Plasma Instrument (PLS). Detector reponses from ion detetors 2P, 4P, and 6P, and from electron detector 4E are available through the PDS as separate files. The energy resolution, angular fields of view, and nominal geometric factors for the detectors are specified in the Instrument Description file.
For each detector the responses (Counts/Sample-Period) are given for a series of energy-per-unit charge steps (E/Q, Volts). These responses are summed over spin sectors. The instrument is programmable, and operating modes are tailored for different mission phases to acquire effective measurements. The E/Q steps and Sample Periods for different mission phases (through Ida) are tabled below.
TABLE A -------------------------------------------------------------- Mission Phase Sample Period, E/Q Steps, Seconds Table --------------------------------------------------------------
Venus 0.400 Table B Earth-1 1.333 Table B Gaspra 1.200 Table B Earth-2 1.200 Table B Ida 1.200 Table B ---------------------------------------------------------------
TABLE B -------------------------------- Step E/Q, Volts
P2,P4,P6 E4 --------------------------------
17 21 19 19 29 27 21 41 38 23 57 53 25 80 74 27 112 104 29 157 146 31 220 204 33 303 281 35 454 422 37 686 638 39 961 893 41 1363 1266 43 1958 1819 45 2732 2538 47 3788 3519 49 5490 5100 51 7777 7225 53 10614 9860 55 15189 14110 57 21356 19839 59 29829 27710 61 40443 37570 63 52521 48790
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: The Venus data set has several data gaps due to missing data and data hits.
